title: Orban's shadow looms over Euronews takeover
summary: The ailing news channel was bought out in 2022 with funds from close associates of Hungary's nationalist prime minister, according to confidential documents.

title: Cannes Film Festival: Selection for 77th edition unveiled
summary: Announced on April 11, the official competition lineup features several cinema greats, including Francis Ford Coppola, David Cronenberg and Paul Schrader.

title: OJ Simpson, ex-NFL star aquitted in the 'trial of the century', dies aged 76
summary: According to a statement by his family, the former football player, who was aquitted of his wife and her friend's murder in 1995, died of cancer.

title: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro intensifies crackdown ahead of presidential election
summary: While the government curbs freedom of expression, the opposition is divided over which candidate should face the incumbent on July 28.

title: Ukraine: Anger over removal of demobilization clause from troop enlistment bill
summary: The army chief abandoned the measure that would have allowed soldiers fighting for three years to return to civilian life and make way for new recruits for fear of destabilizing the frontline.

title: Europa League: Marseille lose to Benfica 2-1 while Liverpool crushed by Atalanta 3-0
summary: The first leg of the Europa League quarter-finals also saw Bayer Leverkusen beat West Ham 2-0 to extend its unbeaten streak to 42 games in a season and Roma defeat AC Milan for the first time since October 2019.

title: US restricts its diplomats' movements in Israel over security fears
summary: The US embassy did not state the cause for the new alarm but Iran has vowed retaliation after Israel on April 1 destroyed an Iranian diplomatic building in Damascus.

title: Trina Robbins, comic book author and feminist historian, has died
summary: The comic artist passed away at 85 years old. In addition to writing for 'Wonder Woman,' she was relentless in her efforts to highlight the frequently minimized role of women in comic book history.

title: Biden administration issues license for massive Texas oil export terminal
summary: Environmentalists denounced the license approval, saying it contradicted President Joe Biden's climate agenda and would lead to 'disastrous' planet-warming greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Mali bans media coverage of political parties
summary: The move comes a day after the West African nation's ruling military junta suspended the activities of political parties.

title: EU lawmakers back call to enshrine abortion in EU rights charter
summary: With 373 votes to 163, MEPs in Brussels voted a symbolic resolution to put access to abortion in the EU's Charter of Fundamental Rights, following France's example, just as a tense debate on the issue was held in Poland.

title: Behind the Faye-Sonko duo's swift rise to power in Senegal
summary: Just 10 days before the presidential election, the two incarcerated men regained their freedom and campaigned to win in a landslide in the first round.

title: Kremlin opponent Navalny's posthumous memoir out in October
summary: The book chronicles his 2020 nerve agent poisoning and life in a brutal Russian prison camp, where he died in February 2024.

title: Mexico files international lawsuit on Ecuador over embassy raid
summary: The suit, filed with the International Court of Justice (ICJ), requests Ecuador's suspension from the United Nations until it issues a public apology acknowledging the violation of the 'norms of international law.'

title: Human Rights groups file UN complaint over French police racial profiling
summary: Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International France, as well as three other French groups, claim that police identity checks abusively target those 'perceived as black or Arab' and 'constitute systemic racial discrimination.'

title: Brazil makes historic, though symbolic, apology to indigenous people
summary: For the first time in the country's history, the President of the Amnesty Commission for reparations of crimes committed during the military dictatorship has extended an apology to indigenous populations.

title: At the roots of evangelical Christians' support for Israel
summary: Evangelical Christians, particularly in the US and Latin America, have been stepping up their support for Israel since October 7, 2023.

title: Journalism and Crisis: Join Le Monde in English for a special event in New York!
summary: Le Monde's English edition crosses the Atlantic from April 15-17 for a series of events in New York City, free and open to the public.

title: Ailing Kering strengthens Gucci's management team
summary: The group chaired by François-Henri Pinault has chosen a former Louis Vuitton executive to assist Jean-François Palus, CEO of the Milanese brand, which is in decline and whose economic health is vital to Kering.

title: Halving: When bitcoin engineers its own scarcity
summary: The conditions for how the leading cryptocurrency is created will change in a few days' time. This operation is one of the keys to the functioning of this market.

title: Les Roches Rouges, a Corsican hotel with a soul
summary: With its 180-degree view of the sea, this century-old establishment clinging to the rocky inlet of Piana, in southern Corsica, has been restored over the years. Revered by loyal clientele, madly in love with its listed façade, the hotel has a guesthouse atmosphere.

title: Argentina court rules Iran ordered 1990s attacks on Israeli sites in Buenos Aires
summary: The ruling also declared Iran a 'terrorist state' and called the 1994 attack on the Argentine Israelite Mutual Association a 'crime against humanity,' according to local media.
